#Text=Iran
#Text=Iran
#Text=( Persian : ایران ) is a large country between the Gulf of Oman , the Persian Gulf , and the Caspian Sea .
#Text=It was renamed Iran in the early 20th century ; before that it was known as Persia .

#Text=It is bordered by Iraq to the west , Turkey , Azerbaijan 's Nakhchivan enclave , Armenia , and Azerbaijan to the northwest , Turkmenistan to the northeast , and Afghanistan and Pakistan to the east .
#Text=Iran can be considered part of the Middle East , and thus it is included as part of that region here .
#Text=However , it is also very much a part of Central Asia ; indeed the Persian Empire was the dominant power in that region for many centuries .
#Text=Cities
#Text=Nine of the most notable cities are :
#Text=( Persian : تهران ) – the vibrant capital , a beautiful city that suffers horrendous traffic and air pollution
#Text=( Persian : همدان ) – one of the oldest cities in Iran
#Text=( Persian : اصفهان‎ ) – a former capital with stunning architecture , great bazaar , and tree-lined boulevards .
#Text=Most popular tourist destination in the country .
#Text=There 's a Persian saying that " Isfahan is half the world .

#Text=( Persian : تبریز ) – a former capital with a great historical bazaar , now a provincial capital in western Iran ; it 's been suggested that this is the site of the Biblical  Garden of Eden "

column1: #Text=( Persian : یزد‎‎ ) – a remote desert city – circumstance influenced special architectural themes where water streams run in underground rooms in houses and wind-towers to keep them cool .
#Text=Other destinations
#Text=( Persian : الموت‎‎ ) , near Qazvin – castle of the legendary Assassins .
#Text=( Persian : دیزین ) – one of the highest ski resorts in the world , two hours north of Tehran .
#Text=Great powder snow , cheap prices and few international visitors makes this is a great place for a ski holiday .
#Text=( Persian : کیش‎‎ ) – a free trade zone in the Persian Gulf , it is regarded as a consumer 's ' paradise ' , with numerous malls , shopping centres , tourist attractions , and resort hotels .
#Text=There is also Iran 's first marina on the east side of the island .
#Text=( Persian : قشم ) – Iran 's largest and the Persian Gulf 's largest island .
#Text=Qeshm island is famous for its wide range of ecotourist attractions such as the Hara marine forests .
#Text=According to environmentalists , about 1.5 % of the world birds and 25 % of Iran 's native birds annually migrate to Hara forests which is the first national geo park .
#Text=( Persian : پاسارگاد ) – the first capital of the Achaemenid Empire , and home to the tomb of Cyrus the Great .
#Text=– impressive ruins of a vast city-like complex built over 2,500 years ago , near the modern city of Shiraz .
#Text=It was set on fire by Alexander of Macedon and further ruined by Arabs .
#Text=Called TakhteJamshid in Persian , Persepolis is the symbol of Iranian nationality .
#Text=( Persian : شوش‎‎ ) – 200 km north of Ahvaz , was Iran 's most ancient city .
#Text=The Ziggurat of Chughazanbil , Darius the Great 's palace , the Jewish prophet Daniel 's temple and Artaxerxer II ' s palace are among the historical sites .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Iran , the wellspring of one of the world 's great civilizations , is a country of striking natural beauty and gorgeous tiled mosques .
#Text=Its landscape is incredibly varied .
#Text=Its recent history has been tumultuous .
#Text=People
#Text=Humans have inhabited the area that makes up modern Iran since the Stone Age .
#Text=There are paintings in Dusheh cave that date back to 15,000 BC .
#Text=The ancient Persians arrived about 1500 BC , one branch of the great movement of people that also brought northern India and most of Europe their modern populations .
#Text=The name Iran is from the same root as " Aryan " which , until Hitler perverted it , was just an ancient name for those arriving peoples .
#Text=Persian
#Text=( natively known as Farsi ) is an Indo-European language ; ancient Persian was related to Sanskrit , ancient Greek , and all the others in that family .
#Text=Persians are ethnically and linguistically unrelated to their neighbours on the west , the Arabs and Turks , but are related to various groups to the east and north .

#Text=Iran has many people other than ethnic Persians ; there are substantial minorities with their own languages , Minorities with Indo-European languages related to Persian include Kurds in parts of the west and northwest , Baluchis in parts of the southeast , and Armenians in the north and in Isfahan where one of the Shahs transported them a few centuries back .
#Text=Minorities with Turkic languages include the Azeris who make up much of the population of Azerbaijan in the northwest and the Qashqai , a nomadic people in the region around Shiraz .
#Text=There are also Arabs and , last but not least , Jews , who have been living in Iran peacefully for centuries .

#Text=There are also two substantial communities of people of Iranian descent in India and Pakistan - Parsis who have been there for over 1,000 years , and Iranis who arrived in the 19th and 20th centuries - both Zoroastrians who fled religious persecution in Iran .
#Text=History
#Text=Persia has always exerted a large cultural influence on its neighbors , especially Afghanistan , the Caucasus and Central Asia .
#Text=Persian influence can be seen in the art , architecture and languages of these areas , and in the Indian Subcontinent .
#Text=The empire existed over most of the time period from about 500 BCE until the revolution of 1979 , but its fortunes varied enormously over the centuries .

#Text=During the Achaemenid Empire , Persia controlled most of what we now call the Middle East , and after Cyrus the Great 's conquest of Ionia , Persia came close to conquering Greece in the Greco-Persian Wars of 499-449 BC .
#Text=In 331 BC , Alexander conquered ( among other places ) the entire Persian Empire .
#Text=Sassanid rule from 205 AD to 651 AD is considered to be the most influential period of ancient Persia .
#Text=In 651 AD , immediately after the death of Muhammad , the brutal conquest of Persia by the Arabs brought an end to the Sasanian Empire .
#Text=Persian and other languages of the region are still written with the Arabic alphabet .
#Text=In 1221 AD , Persia was overrun by Genghis Khan and the Mongols .
#Text=Marco Polo
#Text=passed through later in that century , learned Persian , and wrote extensively of the region .
#Text=Tamerlane conquered Persia in 1383 , and after a revolt in 1387 , killed hundreds of thousands of people and built a tower with their skulls .
#Text=The Safavid dynasty re-united Persia as an independent state in 1501 , established Shi'a Islam as the official religion , and ushered in a golden age of Persian culture .

#Text=The dynasty was overthrown in 1736 by Nader Shah , the last great Asian conqueror , who expanded the empire to again include Afghanistan and much of India . His short-lived dynasty and its successor , the Zand dynasty , lasted until 1795 .
#Text=The Qajar dynasty ruled from 1795-1925 .

#Text=While many of the historic buildings in Iran are from this period , this era is considered to be one of decline for Iran , as the rulers were more interested in building their collections of art and jewels and succumbed to heavy pressure from foreign powers , notably Britain and Russia who jointly occupied Iran during World War I. In 1906 , Qajar rule became a constitutional monarchy and the Majlis ( Persian for parliament ) was established .
